intro: Palala calocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited hakea, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by distinctive red, fleshy fruits. Palala calocarpa is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and dry forests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
